AuthorName.Title: Code Change Patterns as Reusable Code Abstractions
AuthorName.Content: Twitter] ;LinkedIn] Facebook] MDM Arachchige - 2024Software developers reuse the same libraries, frameworks, and algorithms, and they use common programming idioms and best practices. Thus, when they evolve the code, they repeat similar code changes. When one or multiple developers make the same code change in multiple locations, it becomes a code change pattern (CPAT). Manually identifying CPATs and applying them in multiple locations is time-consuming, error-prone, and overwhelms developers. Existing approaches hard …• Cites: ‪What do programmers discuss about deep learning frameworks‬
